3.  Homeless People:  I love when people get all uppity about homeless people ruining the park.  Sure they smell bad, but if you really think about it, this is their home.  So, we're kind of like guests at their place.  Try to be a little more polite....or at least not such a blatant asshole.
4.  Hipsters:  Can their clothes be any tighter?  And what's the deal with the blazer?  It's sunny and 90 degrees outside!

So there you have it.  Washington Square Park.  Gorgeous surroundings, urban oasis, and fantastic people watching.
author: Norm U.

description: The only reason I give this park 4 stars instead of 5 is because the bathroom was really disgusting...other than that we had a great day at the park. Its so nice to get a cup of coffee and a blanket and just veg out in the grass. This park is great for everyone, close to restaurants so you can eat your lunch there and relax, lay in the grass, theres even a playground for the kids. Overall, its very nice. Avoid the restrooms though because they were very dirty, Hit up a restaurant or store for your potty needs, lol.
author: Maya L.

description:
This is one of the best parks in the city.  My most favorite part of this park experience is getting to know all the crazy people who share in it with you.  

Like the guy who walks around in the leather suit, pseudo-sheepishly telling you that he is, in fact, Santana's brother, and then offers to sing Santana songs to you for a nominal fee.  

Then there is the lady with turret's syndrome who walks around the perimeter of the park screaming obscenities.  

Then there is the little Chinese lady who just wants in on your game of whatever; could be soccer, volleyball, football...whatever.  She just wants in.  

And then there is the vaudeville guy, dressed to the nines, who, when given your name, makes perverted songs about you and whoever you're sharing your blanket with.  

Then there is the guy who walks around with the "Tom Selek for Mayor" t-shirt who says that he just can't trust his friends anymore since they turned the FBI on him.  Oh and he ALWAYS carries a football but never throws it.  

Awesome.
author: Lauren S.

description:
People watching.
Frisbee throwing.
Lazy sunbathing.
Dog interaction.

I can see the park from my window, and I still never know in advance what is going on down there during the weekend.  Two weeks ago I walk outside to see some Ferrari fest with over 20 of these sports cars crammed onto our lovely park's grass.  There is an art show every Saturday for those in the area.  Great place for a tourist to drink some coffee and get a taste of what our neighborhood is about.


Update 11-?-06:
Ok, so there isn't an art show every Saturday.  But there is one at least once a month on Saturday and Sunday.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
I love Washington Square Park. I played here as a kid, i did acid here as a teen and I will come here as on old man to sit on the benches.

I liked it better before they put the trees around the statue though.
author: Chris E.

description:
Adam Duritz wrote August and Everything After (the song, not the Album) here. Enough said.

Oh and I once fell asleep drunk here when I was 17. Bet none of you knew that.
author: Lee M.

description:
This park is people-watching perfected: kids, dogs, hopelessly homeless bums, all kinds of tourists, neighborhood vets, crazy old ladies, more dogs, people playing lawn games, Falun Gong zombies, old shirtless men, suntanning beauties, hippie balladeers, etc.

All this under a darting flock of pigeons and the tolling bell of the cathedral across the street.
author: Dustin K.

description: I like people watching but I don't like being harassed.  Every time I come here I get harassed without fail. This place could be so much better and has been so much better.  Sad.
author: Roger H.

description: I love its location, sun exposure, wide lawn space and plentiful benches.  It's the easiest park in the city to have an impromptu picnic supplied by all the delis, bakeries, cafes and wine shops nearby.  It's also home of the boisterous North Beach Festival in the summertime, which can become too Alpha Beta, Psi Chi, etc. for my taste.  But the rest of the time, I'm content on my lawn blanket in the sun, listening to the bells of the Cathedral.
author: M A N I K.

description:
Top park in the city. 
So much fun for one and all!
Good on a first date, a little wine, little cheese, a little smoochin', a little lovin'.

All good people!
author: D. R.

description:
Oh park, I love you. I got to watch 8 1/2 during the Film Night in the park series  here while drinking smuggled whiskey, I've been on first dates here, I've been in grass fights with people here, you're really the best. Thank's for being so close to my house and full of shady trees.

I wish you weren't losing all that grass in the middle though, it's sort of like a bald spot. Also, major props for the kids who filled up a kiddie pool with water when it was really hot a few weeks ago. I think you should all be my future ex boyfriend.
author: Maren C.

description: With the North Beach view and beautiful church as a backdrop, Washington Square Park is one of my favorite places in the city. My ideal day would consist of a sandwich from La Spiaggia, a Mimosa supply, the rare 80 degree weather, and sunshine. Top it off with good company and big sunglasses, and you've got an event! They often feature events and artists- a few weeks ago we enjoyed our fruit gelato while sunbathing, followed by viewing local San Francisco artwork. It was a great sunny day :)
author: Kristin F.

description:
I love my neighborhood park...mostly to pass through while walking to Mama's, the post office, or on a jog. This past weekend there was a movie night in the park which was really lovely...good times with friends, what can beat that? 

You have to catch the tai chi lessons happening in the mornings, it's a riot and also oddly interesting and makes you want to join in...but I wouldn't, I think those women might hurt you...though they're like 4'2"....whatever, anyway...

Loses 1 star for some of the "interesting" people that are usually hanging around during the day.
author: Diane S.

description:
my favorite is riding the 30 at 6am, passing by the locals doing tai chi

inspiring
author: tiff f.

description: Grab a cup of coffee nearby and go sit in the grass on a sunny day.  It's such a wonderful park!
author: Mason G.

description: Cool park, walking distance to a lot of places in North Beach, nice playground set too.  Within walking distance to a lot of good places to eat and drink, and a stop on the Santacon pub crawl.  A good spot for dodgeball apparently...
author: Eric L.

description:
A Benjamin Franklin statue in the park, but why is it named after George Washington.  Hmmm... I'll let you all ponder that for a second.  Ok, second's up!  Did you know that It was a cemetery before it became a park?  Interesting, huh? The park was designed by William Eddy and built in 1850.  

Located in the middle of North Beach with the beautiful Sts. Peter & Paul church and Coit Tower in view, surrounded by coffee shops, restaurants and bars (2 for 1 beer special at Columbus Cafe), spend a beautiful day on the bench shaded by poplar and evergreen trees -- a perfect way to people watch.  Friendly crowd, well-behaved dogs, clean green grassy area, and hot half-naked men sweating in the sun getting their tan on playing volleyball and throwing the football around.  

I love this park.  I've only been living in North Beach for less than a month, but I've already spent a lot of my free time at the park.  Once a friend and I chillded at a a bench one sunny afternoon with a bottle of Hoogarden in a brown paper bag.  Another time, my roomies and I brought sandwiches to the park and enjoyed rich conversations while we watched all the good-looking men walk by.  Last Sunday, friends and I played a little game of baseball.  I hit two people and 1 dog with the ball when I was at-bat before we finally decided that playing in the park wasn't a good idea especially when it's crowded.  Even though our bat and ball was the Giants baseball set for kids, I guess it's still a bit scary to see a ball coming towards you while relaxing on the grass or walking around.  If you see an orange ball coming towards you, don't be afraid... the ball is really, really soft and it won't hurt you... I promise.  

If you ever want to see me on a nice sunny afternoon, look for me at the park with a beer in one hand and a cup of gelato from Naia in the other hand...
author: Celeste M.

description: Grab a sandwich at Molinari's, a beer at Coit Liqour then head to Washington Square to people watch and enjoy your lunch. Then finish off with gelato at Gelato Classico and you've had a great time in North Beach!
author: Thel D.

description: very laid back park, great views of the city, russian and nob hill....great for just pulling up a blanket and relaxing on the grass!
author: Phillip J F.

description:
not a bad place...

walked through here when I'm running around lil italy. nothing like getting some gelato ...
hanging out in the park taking in the shine of the sun, 
the smell of green 
and the beat of the city. 

and then head back down the street for more good food;. 
nothing quite like it....all in a stones throw from the park.
author: John-Michael C.

description: so COOL. ever see Dirty Harry ? this is the park where psycho Scorpio scopes out a gay black guy through his rifle sights. I've been frightened to sit here ever since. but it's such a pretty park, and Sts. Peter & Paul across the way is so historical (boyfriend forever reminds me that Joltin' Joe DiMaggio married his first wife in this Church.) thank you, boyfriend, but I know my trivial history. I was frickin born in this city just like you
author: Prima D.

description: You feel as though all is right with the world as you lounge on the grass on a sunny day..
author: Bleep S.

description: On a nice summer's day, this is a great place to hang out and people watch in the city.
author: Dave D.

description: My favorite park in the entire city.there are tons of great places to sit and watch the birds fly from corner to corner of the park.  The bathrooms are kinda gross, but that's with any park.  Grab some gellato or a sandwich and sit and enjoy!
author: Robin L.

description: I love going here on a weekend when the weather is nice. It's a great place to people watch and have a sandwich and a beer. Went here for a movie in the park last summer and that rocked as well. Plus last time we were there a bum foretold us of the next big one (date passed so no worries) so we decided to make the church our meeting place when said quake happens.
author: Stephen K.

description: This is the best park for people watching. And it will usually have nicer weather than say Golden Gate Park or something. Right in all the action of North Beach and full of activity I guarantee you will not be bored here. And if you are just take a walk to any of the cute cafes across the street.
author: Cathy T.

description:
Fun for people watching and less dog poo than you'd think. At least I have yet to step in any doggie pies in the 3 years I've been coming here. Its a great place on a sunny day to eat a cup of gelato from the nearby Naia or Gelato Classico after brunch at Mama's, Cafe Divine, or WashBag. 
There are always people playing volleyball, football, or throwing around softballs and Frisbees for you to watch and you can't forget about the requisite bums that accost you for food and/or cigarettes. The newest thing I've encountered is the little old Chinese lady hovering over me waiting for my empty coke can. Annoying. 
The only other annoying factor happens to be "that" guy that comes up to you in the park thinking that because you are alone you need company. Does the fact that I am reading AND have an iPod stuck in my ears give you even the slightest clue that maybe I don't want to be bothered? Ahhh yes....I knew there was a disconnect somewhere. 
If you don't mind the occasional pestering passer by then this park really can't be beat. Grab a coffee and a pannini and enjoy the weather and the free reality show.
author: Stacy T.

description: sun. wine. picnic. bubbles. perfect sunday!
author: Anne T.

description: People & dog watching at its finest. When the sun falls on this city, bask in it, & if you live nearby, do it at this park!
author: Melisser E.

description: 3 stars for being in close proximity to Liguria Bakery, 2 stars for public events in the park like the movies they play in summer (last year, Fellini's 8 1/2).
author: Caroline C.

description: I once saw this old Chinese man peeing in the bushes. Seemed out of place in such a picturesque park. Great people watching.
author: Judy L.

description:
so, while the petite bourgeoisie may be extending their coverage of the north end of the city past the marina green, padding (or cablecarring) down from russian hill and wandering up from the Embarcadero, you'll find the traditional north beach denizens on display in Washington Square Park (WSP) as well.   and by traditional, i mean the odd writers, artists, poets, and hippie bums.  WSP is mostly waspy on a bright, sunny day, and the same assholes who you would normally find playing beiruit (beer-pong, for the uninitiated) often times set up a kiddie pool, or some sort of odd mix between lawn bowling and horseshoes.  hate to reference colombia again, but they had a similar game there, except you were throwing into a pit filled with gunpowder.  maybe that's why i liked it there.  lots of explosions.  

anyway, while looking around the park, you'll likely exclaim, "damn, that's a lot of white people," but they are white people of different varieties, so it's more or less ok.  yes, there are the preppy assholes whose baseball caps have frayed along the brims, and who you can identify by their tribal tattoos and tramp stamps, readying themselves for a night of accidental procreation and VD passage by drinking beer in the sun.  but, at the same time there are others, with tattoos more tasteful and artistic, with dogs, with children, with books, frisbees, and soccer balls.  when it's sunny, this is where the neighborhood comes to pass away a lazy afternoon, doing whatever it is that they do.  you can find blond spa denizens in bikinis, dreadlocked hippies, impromptu four piece string bands, and completely insane shelter-challenged individuals engaging you in conversation, but oddly not asking for money.

it's a sort of people's park, back when that wasn't just somewhere homeless people slept, and the people watching is fantastic.  still pales in comparison to dolores park, but what doesn't?  it is the reason i like north beach, in terms of how the space feels...
author: matt w.

description: Where I went the first time I found out San Francisco flips the bird to open container law... Thank you, San Francisco, for allowing me to sit in a park full of hippies and homeless drunk off my ass and not having to hide my booze in a paper bag or nalgene bottle.
author: Valerie G.

description:
if there is one thing i miss from the NB days, it is this crazy little park.  i've been serenaded by weirdos with guitars, attacked by puppies, sunburned and then frozen by the fog rolling in, read for hours/days, probably smacked with a soccer or volley ball a few times, probably been accosted by a mad pigeon or two, watched many an old-chinese-people-stretching-in-rings and parading in the early morn, heard many a conversation between homeless duos (and singles), recouperated my bored, anxious mind gazing at others and daydreaming about their differently bored or anxious minds, probably accumulated a lifetime of bad phone karma from forwarding naked pictures in someones lost cell phone to their entry for 'mom', and drank many a coffee and bubble tea.

I was going to give 4 stars since i've been overcrowded out of the park and chased off by foul smelling, tanning hairy beasts (usually men, sometimes women), but maybe that's why i want to give it 5, too.  It's close, tension draws me back.  This is a great park to have in your neighborhood.  (and movie nights in the summer are a fun thing that many don't know about.)
author: Today Y.

description: I love this park.  Tiny, very friendly, and extremely relaxing when you would like to nap on the grass under the sun.  You never know who you'll see.
author: Meredith M.

description: wonderful place to sit in a sunny spot and people watch.  there's abit of everything to see - crazies and picniking hipsters and old asian ladies, lots of dogs and vigilant owners chasing them with plastic baggies.  Make a holiday of it and eat breakfast at Mama's first.
author: Catherine S.

description: While visiting San Fran recently my husband and I spent a couple leisurely hours digesting our huge Italian lunch here.  I've never seen so many weirdos in my life (and I live in DC)-- and weirdos from all different walks of life. But that said, it was pretty entertaining to spectate at all of the randomness going on around us, except for what I am sure was a group of drug dealers turning some major profits over the course of the afternoon. I would NOT recommend children here, considering dogs are running wild, drugs are being bought and sold but mainly smoked, and lots of homeless lurk.
author: Nina B.

description: Wonderful park to lay out in the sun on a warm weekend day overlooking the beautiful St Peter and Paul's Church. Every summer, the North Beach Jazz festival is also held here and the North Beach Street fair also hosts the vendors in the surrounding park area.
author: Yan M.

description: Great place to lie in the grass and chill out in the sun on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon.  While my boyfriend and I were there we saw a couple getting married - great place for it!  And great food and drinks are a stone's throw away.
author: nicole h.

description: This is a community park, there's never a dull moment here. The park is surrounded by tons of different restaurants that you can get some take out at & mosy on over to a nice spot in the sun (Molinari's, Divine Cafe, Melt). There's always a guitar strumming, puppies having their first walk on a leash, some fierce volleyball going on, some tossing of the old pig skin, friends having a laff... it's as perfect as it gets on a warm sunny day. Mix in some locals, some out of town visitors, folks from Chinatown & Telegraph hill and you have the Washington Square Park community.
author: flo t.

description: I know the vaudeville guy Lauren S. is talkign about, he came and visited me at the Rogue Brewery.  So not many outsiders to North Beach see the park in the morning, but the elderly Chinese come to do their Tai Chi.  At first I was put off by the whole activitiy, but now I've come to accept it as something special and really nice.  I just wish they didn't look at me so meanly when I have my dog.  On that note, the park is where my dog goes to the bathroom, most dogs in the neighborhood come to the park to go poo as well.  Don't sit on the outside perimeter of the park, these are most likely to be the pee and poo spots.  Watch out at night, it gets sketchy.  I love this place and see it as my haven.
author: Lindsay T.

description: My friendly neighborhood park, and thank goodness for it.  People-watching, sun, volleyball...I have absolutely zero complaints about it.  Far fewer unleashed dogs than Dolores Park (only a good thing, in my opinion) and far less sketchy than Buena Vista or even GGP.  Come, sit, relax.  You just can't go wrong.
author: Sheila W.

description: Super place for a lunch date with someone who doesn't mind sitting on the grass. I wouldn't try it out on someone "new", but if you've got a tried-and-true beau or an easy-going boo, I suggest: Summertime (July-October), daytime, sandwiches at Molinari (I highly recommend anything with sopresatta, fresh morzarella, and sundried tomatoes), a nice spot in the grass where you can be a vicarious pet owner through other people's dogs, then end your lunch date with some gelatto (i like Naia). Do this, and your work week will become 85.6% more pleasurable.
author: kay v.

description: too many dogs, too close to a church.  but not a bad place to recover after breakfast at Mamas on wahington square (best breakfast in town)
author: kiki b.

description: this is one of the best places to spend a sunny weekend day. pick up a bomber at coit liquor and a north beach special sandwich from molinari's and hang here for the day. great people watching...
author: Kate M.

description: I am a big fan of this park, slightly due to the fact that it's a block away from the bf's apartment and right in front of the bus stop i use to get home. The only negative is that 1) it's in the middle of north beach, ie party city, so towards the end of the summer movie in the park there are tons of drunk people wandering around, yelling. and 2) it's so small that you can never really escape in this park. No matter where you go, there is the street, tons of cars parked on it and most likely a line of cars honking on Columbus Street. More reasons why I like it though? it's always crowded but not TOO crowded meaning you're not alone and creeped out but you can usually always find a good spot to camp out. We usually go there when we want to eat lunch outside (RIP Palermos) Otherwise its a good place to get some beers or a bottle of Belvedere in our case and hang out, get drunk then stumble home. FYI, there are always little asian women looking for cans and they can sometimes get annoying. We had a "party" here once complete with mini swimming pool and horseshoes and the women lurked around us the entire time. They even stood in our talking circles for some reason. Kind of odd. They were waiting to take our cans but geez, wait until we're done you know? That was the only downfall I could think of...well, that and those cars.
author: Sarah I.

description: great place to relax and watch awesome tai chi.
author: James B.
